content: this is dmg and we're making coffins bring out your dead
okay so the winner of my 2,500 subscriber competition got to pick what
this topic was there were a lot of entries and unsurprisingly there are a
lot of people who wanted to have torture chambers but instead is chosen to resort
to two ones coffin idea so that's what we're going to be doing here so I'm
grabbing some five popsicle sticks and I'm going to stick three of them
together so these popsicle sticks need to be more than ten centimeters long
where you can get shorter ones if you want but you'd have to modify this build
so I'm just gonna hot glue down the long sides and stick them together and I'm
gonna wipe off any excess glue when it is cooled slightly so I don't burn
myself all right then I'm going to measure out the ten centimeters make
sure I don't I don't want those kill bits at the end so I'm going to cut them
off so I measure out enemies and then measure five centimeters into the middle
and a ruler line across connecting the dots so I did the dots on both sides and
then I'm just going to cut off the curved bits on the end so we now have a
long straight piece and then just cut straight through the middle so I now
have two 5 centimeter long plaques or boards and from the edge the 1 inch I'm
measuring 2 centimeters in on both boards and then I'm going to go
diagonally from that measurement to the edge of the center plank so from the 2
centimeter mark to the edge of this inner plank in both directions and
that's going to form the basic shape of the coffin and from there it'll be a lot
easier to guide and cut out what we're doing and then I just repeat the same
process on the other one as well and just make sure that they're aligned
both sides everything is flush and correct measure
twice cut once and then I'm just cutting along those lines to get rid of the the
edges and that forms the shape of the coffin so what we're going to do next
we're going to build up the sides of the coffin so so we just check that
everything is flush that's all fine if you people have asked me about when
cutting these pieces of wood am I using some sort of special scissors no these
are just basic kitchen scissors that you would normally use to cut through
chicken bones and things and I'm using very very very cheap tongue depressors
so the wood is not exactly high quality but it doesn't need to be so now what
I'm doing is I'm just measuring the edges against the piece of the tongue
depressors the lollipop stick and I'm just going to cut those out and start to
stick mom I will need extra ages but I'll just do that when I've run out here
and it's just basically runs in hot glue along with the flat edge and you can do
just one at a time I'm doing two but you need to be pretty quick otherwise the
glue hardens and then you have to scrape it off and start again so again on top
not on the sides I'm placing those boards and then once the glue is dried
I'm just placing more it doesn't take very long to it for the glue to harden
it happens pretty quickly and I'm just sticking the pieces there so everything
is glued on the edges and then placing along the edge of the previous plank and
then along with flat board and putting in the extra side everything must be
flush and now I'm just measuring those extra ages we talked about earlier and
cut them out and apply them with hot glue so the final piece which I put on
here basically gonna put it on as one long
piece and as you can see the original one at the foot that I put on is
slightly higher than the rest now I like to do that so that it will help stick
down the top board now you don't have to do that if you don't want to it's just
something I did for effect you can't cut it flush so essentially I
just put that on so that I could keep a bit of a look to it and now I'm just
going to apply the top part to the coffin now you don't have to do this
step if you want haven't open a coffin just leave it off and so that you'd be
able but the painting then you'd have to paint the interior as well while I'm
doing here is once the glue is dry Adams cutting off any bits that are sticking
out and on the lid I'm now applying some hot glue and I'm just gonna apply some
of those curved pieces that I took trimmed off earlier just to have some
sort of emblem part you could put her a holy symbol or something on there or a
ward or anything can basically go on there just to give it a little bit of a
special look so now I've basted with the black spray paint is in video three and
I'm now applying applying straight brown acrylic paint and I've just used boots
of speed to speed up the process here now it this is very similar to the
wooden door video where I did the same and we just got to make it sort of look
but rod a bit rotten so I'm going to add some yellow in after this so just a dash
of yellow and then I'm just going to sort of almost dry brush it but not
really it's still wet just applying small amounts of yellow so
not large amounts there's small amounts of yellow using boots of speed just to
speed it up and you so it gives you a really muddy sort of brown it will dry
darker so we're going to apply some white now this I'm just getting rid of
excess paint on the edge of the little bowler then I'm just going to dust the
white paint on so rather than paint it on really basically just skimming over
the edges to pick up the detail of the wood and concentrating more on the edges
to bring out the detail of edges you can see it really brings out the wooden
texture and it sort of gives it that old wooden box look which is exactly what
we're going for in a dungeon scenario you can imagine that these have been
down you farmers of years and you can apply wisps or little bits of cotton
wool or something for cobwebs if you want so that's what it will look like on
a tile it's a bit of few skeletons roaming around protecting whoever the
overlord is so that's simple easy confidence now you can obviously create
this without the lid on it you merely just don't glue the little two there and
then you can stick a little scaling Skellington skeleton mini inside we'll
be showing you how to do these soon so if you liked this video you know what to
